title: Marian Black/Yellow Hazard Striped Tunnel Tape, 3" x 40 Yards, 1 Roll
features: Adhesive hazard tape for use in securing cabling to floors in foot traffic areas
Yellow and black striping for easy hazard recognition
Adhesive remains sticky for repeated use
Operating temperature range of -31 to +176 degrees F
Hand tearable for ease of cutting
description: This Marian MC56-340 adhesive hazard tape is 3" wide and 40 yd. long and has a yellow and black stripe pattern for easy recognition. An adhesive strip on each edge of the tape secures cabling to the floor in foot traffic areas and is hand-tearable for ease of cutting. The adhesive remains sticky to allow repeated use and the tape has an operating temperature range of -31 to +176 degrees F. This hazard tape is suitable for applications such as covering speaker wire or power cords in an auditorium to prevent tripping.

Marian manufactures die-cut components for consumer electronics, automotive, and medical industries. The company, founded in 1954, is headquartered in Indianapolis, IN, and meets International Standards Organization (ISO) standard 9001:2008.
